wikipedia_page.main: Sir Stephen Price Richards (born 8 December 1950) is a former Lord Justice of Appeal.

link_mentions.page: List of current members of the British Privy Council
R (Factortame Ltd) v Secretary of State for Transport
response: In its judgment delivered on 5 March 1996,, Joined Cases C-46/93 and C-48/93: Brasserie du Pêcheur SA v Federal Republic of Germany; and The Queen v Secretary of State for Transport, ex parte Factortame Ltd and Others" 5 Mar 1996. Tesauro, AG; 6 other EU member state governments; the European Commission, 8 lawyers for 97 Claimants, and J.E. Collins, Stephen Richards, Christopher Vajda and Rhodri Thompson for the Respondent. the court of nine justices en banc reaffirmed the right of reparation, and stated that it existed irrespective of whether the provision of Community law in question has direct effect. Furthermore, the principle applies to any case where a member state breaches Community law, irrespective of which organ of the state was responsible for the breach. The ECJ rejected the contentions that the right to reparation required the introduction of legislation by the EU, and that the availability of damages should be decided, in each case, on the basis of the national law of the state in question.
* Stephen Richards (politician) (1820–1894), lawyer and politician from Ontario, Canada
* Sir Stephen Richards (judge) (born 1950), Lord Justice of Appeal
* Stephen Richards (author), British investigative journalist and author, who founded Mirage Publishing in 1998
* Stephen Richards (musician) (born 1977), vocalist and guitarist in the rock music group Taproot
* Stephen Richards (canoeist) (born 1965), New Zealand sprint canoer
* Stephen Richards, alternative stage name of Mark Stevens (actor) (1916–1994)
